events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision involving their car on the downtown street during rush hour traffic.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident category after reviewing the initial accident report details.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim promptly.
Acknowledgement of the claim has been sent to the customer with information about the next steps.
Customer was requested to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a repair estimate.
Customer submitted all required documents including the police report and detailed repair estimates.
Investigation team started evaluating the evidence and circumstances of the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and damages are covered under policy.
A fair settlement proposal has been drafted and sent to the customer for review and approval.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the quick processing and clarity of the settlement offer.
The claim has been officially approved by the claims manager with the settlement amount finalized.
Payment was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account as per the approved settlement agreement.
The auto accident claim file has been closed following successful payment and confirmation from customer.
The claim documents and case details were archived for record keeping and future reference purposes.
